studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: AION BIOSYSTEMS tempshield
arms.description: Participants wear the AION BIOSYSTEMS tempshield continuous temperature monitoring device on the upper chest for up to 7 hours with oral temperature measurements taken every 2 hours using Welch Allyn 901053 Electronic Thermometer as comparator

studyCohorts.name: Febrile
studyCohorts.characteristic: Participants with oral temperature measurement of 99.5°F or above

studyCohorts.name: Non-febrile
studyCohorts.characteristic: Participants who never exceed 99.5°F and remain within normal temperature range

objectives.name: Primary Data Collection Objective
objectives.text: Collect human test data using tempshield to comply with ISO 80601-2-56 for a digital thermometer per FDA guidance for children. In particular children under the age of 5 years.

objectives.name: Comparative Validation Objective
objectives.text: To compare the collected tempshield data against a Welch Allyn 901053 Electronic Thermometer as used in clinical settings.

objectives.name: Device Effectiveness Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the effectiveness of the AION BIOSTYEMS, INC. tempshield ("Shield") temperature monitoring device and platform in detecting body temperature for children 2-4 years old.

endpoints.name: Algorithm Validation Endpoint
endpoints.text: To collect enough data points to determine statistically if the current algorithm (5 years and up) applies to children under five.

endpoints.name: Algorithm Age Adjustment Endpoint
endpoints.text: To collect enough data to age adjust the algorithm used.

studyInterventions.name: AION BIOSYSTEMS, INC. system
studyInterventions.description: Investigational medical device system being evaluated in this study

activities.name: Consenting and Inclusion
activities.description: Waiver of documentation of consent and assent for participants due to minimal risk study involving no procedures requiring written consent outside research context

activities.name: Procedures Following Enrollment
activities.description: Enrollment procedures including device placement preparation and study setup

activities.name: tempshield device placement
activities.description: The tempshield wearable device will be placed on the upper chest with gentle, silicon adhesive tape. The research team will register the wearable device and connect it to the AION BIOSTYEMS, INC. Shield app via the Samsung A13

activities.name: Oral temperature measurement
activities.description: Oral temperature taken by the research team using a Welch Allyn 901053 Oral Thermometer and input information into the AION BIOSTYEMS, INC. app. Research coordinators will measure oral temperatures every 2 hours ±1 hour over the 24hour period, with a maximum of 6 recordings per pt

activities.name: Data recording in Shield app
activities.description: Measurements of the tempshield sensor temperature will be recorded in the AION BIOSTYEMS, INC. Shield app. Oral temperatures will be de-identified and recorded in the app for comparison against tempshield data for clinical validation

notes.text: Subjects will receive a $25 Amazon or Target gift card after second oral temperature is obtained
Children will receive the $10-$20 small stuffed toy after the second oral temperature reading is obtained
Device will be removed overnight when outside of research hours
Research coordinators will measure oral temperatures every 2 hours ±1 hour over the 24hour period, with a maximum of 6 recordings per pt

titles.text: A prospective, interventional study assessing the effectiveness of the AION BIOSTYEMS, INC. tempshield ("Shield") for continuous temperature monitoring device in the Pediatric Emergency Department.

indications.name: Continuous Temperature Monitoring
indications.description: Continuous temperature monitoring in the Pediatric Emergency Department

study.name: A prospective, interventional study assessing the effectiveness of the AION BIOSTYEMS, INC. tempshield ("Shield") for continuous temperature monitoring device in the Pediatric Emergency Department.

narrativeContents.name: Identification and Description of the Investigational Device
narrativeContents.sectionTitle: Identification and Description of the Investigational Device

narrativeContents.name: Justification for the Design of the Clinical Investigation
narrativeContents.sectionTitle: Justification for the Design of the Clinical Investigation

narrativeContents.name: Risks and Benefits of Investigational Device and Study
narrativeContents.sectionTitle: Risks and Benefits of Investigational Device and Study

narrativeContents.name: Objectives and Hypotheses of the Clinical Investigation
narrativeContents.sectionTitle: Objectives and Hypotheses of the Clinical Investigation

procedures.name: Oral Temperature Measurement
procedures.label: Oral Temperature
procedures.description: Measurement of oral temperature using Welch Allyn 901053 oral thermometer every 2 hours ±1 hour over the study period

code.decode: Screening test of visual acuity, quantitative, bilateral

procedures.name: Continuous Temperature Monitoring
procedures.label: Continuous Temp Monitoring
procedures.description: Continuous temperature monitoring using AION BIOSTYEMS tempshield device placed on upper chest for up to 7 hours

code.decode: Collection and interpretation of physiologic data

procedures.name: Device Placement
procedures.label: Tempshield Placement
procedures.description: Placement of tempshield wearable device on the upper chest with gentle silicon adhesive tape, directly in contact with skin below clavicle

procedures.name: Height Measurement
procedures.label: Height Measurement
procedures.description: Measurement of participant height if not recorded in EMR for current visit

procedures.name: Device Removal
procedures.label: Tempshield Removal
procedures.description: Removal of tempshield device from participant at end of study period, before radiology imaging, or at ED discharge

procedures.name: Radiology Imaging
procedures.label: Radiology Procedures
procedures.description: CT, MRI, or X-Ray imaging procedures requiring device removal prior to procedure

medicalDevices.name: AION BIOSTYEMS tempshield
medicalDevices.label: Shield
medicalDevices.description: Continuous temperature monitoring wearable device placed on upper chest with silicone-based hypoallergenic adhesive tape for skin temperature collection and transmission to mobile device

medicalDevices.name: Welch Allyn Oral Thermometer
medicalDevices.label: Oral Thermometer
medicalDevices.description: Clinical oral thermometer used as gold standard reference for temperature measurement

medicalDevices.name: Samsung A13 Phone
medicalDevices.label: Mobile Device
medicalDevices.description: Mobile device used to collect skin temperature data, perform AION Biostyems conversion algorithm, and transmit data to AION Biostyems Core via Shield mobile app

medicalDevices.name: AION BIOSTYEMS Shield Mobile App
medicalDevices.label: Shield App
medicalDevices.description: Mobile application installed on Samsung phone for device activation, real-time physiological parameter viewing, and oral temperature data input

conditions.name: Febrile Confirmation Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for confirming febrile status at enrollment
conditions.text: Oral measurement with Welch Allyn clinical thermometer >= 99.5 F

conditions.name: Age Eligibility
conditions.text: Participants between the ages of 2-4 years

conditions.name: Nonfebrile Patient Cap
conditions.description: Maximum number of nonfebrile patients allowed
conditions.text: Study will not include more than 25 nonfebrile patients

conditions.name: Anatomical Limitation Exclusion
conditions.text: Participants presenting an anatomical limitation that would prevent the use of the wearable device

conditions.name: AE Causality - Definite
conditions.text: Clear evidence to suggest a causal relationship, and other possible contributing factors can be ruled out. Clear clinical response to withdrawal of study intervention.

conditions.name: AE Causality - Probable
conditions.text: Reasonable temporal sequence from study intervention, influence of other factors is unlikely, clinically reasonable response on withdrawal of study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Inclusion/Exclusion Deviation Handling
transitionRules.text: If a subject who does not meet inclusion/exclusion criteria is inadvertently included, the Sponsor or a specified designee should be immediately contacted to obtain instructions on whether the subject should be discontinued from the study.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Adverse Events
transitionRules.text: Intolerable AE occurrence or treatment forces subject to stop participation in the study

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Non-compliance
transitionRules.text: Non-compliance of protocol and required procedures

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Parent/Legal Representative Withdrawal Request
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Parents/Legal representatives' request to withdraw child from study

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Adverse Event Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Intolerable AE occurrence or treatment forces subject to stop participation in the study

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Protocol Non-compliance
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Non-compliance of protocol and required procedures

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of all protocol-required visits and device usage period

analysisPopulations.name: Full Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: FAS
analysisPopulations.description: All participants who were enrolled and had the tempshield device applied for temperature monitoring
analysisPopulations.criteria: Enrolled subjects who had the device applied and at least one temperature reading recorded

analysisPopulations.name: Safety Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: SAF
analysisPopulations.description: All participants who had the tempshield device applied to their skin
analysisPopulations.criteria: All subjects who had the investigational device applied

analysisPopulations.name: Per-Protocol Population
analysisPopulations.label: PP
analysisPopulations.description: All participants who completed the study without major protocol deviations
analysisPopulations.criteria: Subjects who completed the study period with device worn for required duration without major protocol deviations

characteristics.name: Age
characteristics.description: Age at baseline in years (2-4 years old per inclusion criteria)

characteristics.name: Reason for ED Visit
characteristics.description: Primary reason for emergency department presentation

characteristics.name: Baseline Temperature
characteristics.description: Temperature at baseline measured by Welch Allyn 901053 oral thermometer

characteristics.name: Fever Status at Baseline
characteristics.description: Presence or absence of fever at time of enrollment

characteristics.name: Duration of Device Wear
characteristics.description: Total time the tempshield device was worn (maximum 7 hours)

commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table of Contents - Section 6.2.7 Number of Study Centers
Table of Contents - Section 8 Data Management

commentAnnotations.text: For the purposes of this study, the patient will only be monitored for any newly diagnosed skin condition (e.g., dermatitis, abrasion) at the site of the study device use throughout the duration of subjects' participation in the study.

A planned hospitalization for pre-existing condition without a serious deterioration in health or to prevent life threatening illness or injury or permanent impairment to a body structure or a body function, is not considered to be a SAE.

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Clinical Investigation Plan for AION BIOSYSTEMS tempshield continuous temperature monitoring device study in Pediatric Emergency Department

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 9 - Amendments of the Clinical Investigation Plan
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Protocol establishes amendment procedures requiring joint agreement between Principal Investigators and AION BIOSYSTEMS, INC., with EC/IRB approval before implementation

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 10 - Deviations from the Clinical Investigation Plan
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Protocol establishes deviation procedures requiring documentation, rationale, and pre-approval before deviations occur

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Protocol version 2.13 dated 1 May 2024 represents current version; specific amendment rationale not detailed in provided text
Compliance with ISO 14155:2020 requirements for clinical investigation quality assurance and control

studyChanges.afterText: No change to the protocol may be made without the joint agreement of both the Principal Investigators and AION BIOSTYEMS, INC.. Any amendment to the original protocol will be made by AION BIOSTYEMS, INC.. The written amendment must be submitted to ECs/IRBs and the Principal Investigator must await for the approval before implementing the changes, as applicable per local law.
studyChanges.summary: Established formal amendment approval process requiring joint PI and Sponsor agreement plus EC/IRB approval

studyChanges.afterText: If in the judgment of the ECs/IRBs, the Principal Investigator, and/or AION BIOSTYEMS, INC., the amendment to the protocol substantially changes the study design and/or increases the potential risk to the subject and/or has an impact on the subject's involvement as a study subject, enrolled study subjects will be informed of any changes.
studyChanges.summary: Added requirement to inform enrolled subjects of substantial protocol changes affecting study design, risk, or subject involvement

studyChanges.afterText: Approvals for deviations will be obtained before the deviation occurs.
studyChanges.summary: Added requirement for pre-approval of protocol deviations
